comments.text:
I feel like people are thinking that college needs to be finished in one 
straight go. It doesn't. While its best to finish within 4-6 years, you can 
spread out classes throughout the year, take the minimum credit hours per 
semester, and attend a local college. While working or something.

Or simply take the classes you need to get you further in whatever career 
you are in. My brother is in the National Guard. He could attend college, 
but he isn't. Every so often he will go to Texas, Philly or some place to 
take some classes or train for a few months. This changes his ranking.

So, basically, look at what you wanna do in your career and only take the 
necessary path. Don't graduate with a Chemistry degree and end up working 
at Walmart for the rest of your life. (over exaggerating here). plus you 
wouldn't be able to pay of your loans very well.

Hope that very long rant helped clarify what getting more of an education 
can mean. College or simply taking classes (held by a college or by your 
job). Or reading. A whole bunch.

comments.text:
+Kathryn Hausler That is BEAUTIFUL!!! And SO thoughtful...I call people 
like you "Earth Angels". A stage manager may make enough money to survive 
and thrive...you may want to look into what you have to do to obtain a 
position like this. I think you may have to work your way up, even with a 
diploma. I'm not 100%, but something I would look into if I was in your 
position. 

Sorry I didn't see these messages until today. 

I wanted to be a teacher when I was younger, until I found out how much 
they make. You may already be aware of how little teachers make and how 
most teachers have 2nd and 3rd jobs, just to make ends meet. The art 
teacher at my son's school teaches at 3 different schools (she has been 
teaching for 35 years) and she confided in me that she is barely pushing 
through. This woman is an amazing artist, has multiple degrees and a GREAT 
teacher! So, I guess what I am trying to say is do some investigation on 
what the approximate income is for the position/s you want and are working 
towards...then calculate what you will owe when you are done with your 
degree/s. This will give you a clear picture of how long it will take to 
pay off your student loans (if you are able to get the job you want...it 
sucks but the reality is..it is a big IF) and then you can also calculate 
what your income will be after and if it's worth it. 

Man...I couldn't agree more...the U.S. education system is completely 
screwed! The "elite" might as well say "go rack up some more debt kids!!" 
Ugh! 

I wish you the best of luck in your ventures and dreams! I hope you not 
only succeed...but prove me wrong! :)) Much love to you and yours ♡

+Nina Schrock not necessarily. But there is a serious problem and she is 
trying to work with what she has. But the problem is this: most cafeteria 
food is the products of major food corporations. 80% of the money in the 
school lunch program never even makes it into the cafeteria. Why? Because 
most of it goes to the food corporations. Bush made it seem like he was 
extending school lunch programs and helping hungry children when in reality 
he was just scratching the backs of big business. Not only do they get a 
load of subsidies but they get to have poor children eat their food and get 
hooked to the salts and sugars they process and use without even know it's 
from the same companies who make McDonald's, coca cola and much more. 
Healthy food can be delicious and filling. But it won't happen until 
Congress stops kissing ass to the super wealthy. Obama is simply trying to 
work with the crap she has.

comments.text:
+Peanut Butter then I'd apologise and say that I didn't mean to hurt you :)
Let me tell you one thing: in 'liking a sex' and 'having sex with' the word 
sex has a completely different meaning. In 'liking a sex', sex (sex; noun) 
means 'man' or 'woman' and in 'having sex with', sex (having sex with; 
verb) means 'doing the do', 'fuck', 'doing the thing' or whatever you want 
to call it. Please don't confuse those two, because that will cause awkward 
situations haha.
And you said "i think my dog is cute doesn't mean ill have sex with it" and 
that's more than logical, but do you think that, for example, boys who like 
boys think "hey, that boy is cute, let's have sex with him"? Because they 
don't, just as you don't think "that person is really attractive, I'm gonna 
have sex". The way you said that sentence I quoted, it sounds like you're 
implying that homosexual people think that, while heterosexual people 
don't. But it could also be that you just confused the two meanings of the 
word "sex" and then I'll take everything back.
And one more thing: love is a feeling and you can't pick feelings. 
Conclusion: you can't pick what sex you like.
But if you're not going to change your opinion, then that's okay. You do 
you. Just try not to harm other people with your believes though. You 
wouldn't like it either when homosexual people told you that you were wrong 
and disgusting and that you should just leave. And before you say "but 
that's not true, I'm normal, they aren't", that's the same thing they would 
say about you. Try to see things from another person's perspective, it 
makes life easier for the both of you :)
